H0.text: What was the capital of the Portuguese empire from 1808 to 1815. Lisbon

H1.text: What was the capital of the Portuguese empire from 1808 to 1815. Rio de Janeiro

H2.text: What was the capital of the Portuguese empire from 1808 to 1815. Salvador

H3.text: What was the capital of the Portuguese empire from 1808 to 1815. BRRIO

A4.text: For thirteen years, Rio de Janeiro functioned as the capital of the United Kingdom of Portugal, Brazil and the Algarves in what some historians call a metropolitan reversal (i.e., a colony exercising governance over the entirety of an empire).

A5.text: the prince regent immediately opened the ports of Brazil to foreign shipping and turned the colonial capital into the seat of government.

A6.text: In 1808, when the Portuguese Royal Family and most of the associated Lisbon nobles, fleeing from Napoleon's invasion of Portugal, moved to Rio de Janeiro. The kingdom's capital was transferred to the city.

A7.text: The kingdom's capital was transferred to the city, which, thus, became the only European capital outside of Europe.
